trial_identification.studytitle: A controlled longitudinal study of caries prevention in children aged 2 to 4 years
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised longitudinal phase III study to evaluate the effects of chlorhexidine toothpaste and Casein Phosphopeptide - Amorphous Calcium Phosphate (CPP-ACP Tooth Mousse) in the treatment of condition Early Childhood Caries to prevent carious lesions in deciduous teeth

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: Toothbrushing daily only with low dose fluoride toothpaste or in combination with either CPP-ACP Tooth Mousse or 0.2% chlorhexidine toothpaste from 2 to four years of age.
interventions.comparator: Control group is toothbrushing daily with only low dose fluoride toothpaste

primaryOutcome.outcome: Less numbers of carious lesions and/ or demineralised tooth surfaces as detected through visual examination

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Lower levels of decay causing bacteria as detected through Caries Risk Test (CRT) Bacteria Test by Ivoclar

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All mothers who completed research Study "Preventive Strategies for Early Childhood Caries from Antenatal to age 24 months"
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Children with milk protein allergies will be removed from the intervention group of Tooth mousse and continue with the control group

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using procedures such as coin tossing and dice rolling

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
In this study, we will be continuing to follow participants recruited for the research project Preventive Strategies for Early Childhood Caries from Antenatal to age 24 months" Princess Alexandra (PA) Ethics no. 2006/145, and Australian Clinical Trials Registry (ACTR) registration number ACTRN012606000356561 who have undergone preventative methods of education, home visits and toothbrushing with low-dose fluoride toothpaste, 0.2% chlorhexidine gel and casein-phosphopeptide amorphous calcium phosphate (CPP-ACP, ToothMousse).
The effectiveness of these strategies will be assessed through - Pre- and post questionnaires - microbial analysis for the presence of decay causing bacteria - dental screen analysis for all participants at age 3 and 4 - statistical analysis of data for case and control groups
